Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is partly greyish in section, the interior is covered with patches of a yellow-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip, which has flaked away in parts, and remains of at least two lines of red-painted cursive text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394714) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394714)
